INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
May 18, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of May 14, with re-
ference to the yellow fever situation in West Africa.
Your suggestions will have careful consideration.
After the meeting of the Board next Tuesday, it may be
that some definite policy concerning West Africa can be
formulated. In the meantime, I want you to know how
deeply I appreciate not only the thought you are giving
to yellow fever problems but also your entire willingness
to sacrifice your personal comfort and plans for the
good of the cause.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor Henry R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D. C.
